alert.note: Alert for Henry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 01 at 1:37AM EDT until April 01 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, southern Henry, southeast Oldham and northwest Shelby. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eminence, Pleasureville, Bellview, North Pleasureville, Cropper, Bethlehem, Defoe, Chestnut Grove, Slabtown, and Lockport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
